title: SaaS Seed fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: SaaS seed investors benchmark against these key metrics to evaluate product-market fit and capital efficiency. The bar has risenâ€”investors expect more proof of retention and economics earlier. Focus on demonstrating sustainable growth, not just user acquisition. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR)
metrics.note: Range for seed-stage SaaS. Lower end acceptable with strong growth; higher end expected for larger rounds.

metrics.label: MRR Growth Rate
metrics.note: Month-over-month growth. Consistency matters as much as peak rates. 20% monthly compounds to 9x annually.

metrics.label: Net Revenue Retention (NRR)
metrics.note: NRR above 100% indicates expansion exceeds churn. Early evidence of NRR >100% is a strong PMF signal.

metrics.label: Logo Retention
metrics.note: Monthly customer retention. Below these thresholds indicates product-market fit issues requiring attention.

metrics.label: CAC Payback Period
metrics.note: Months to recover acquisition cost. Under 12 is excellent, 18-24 acceptable with clear improvement path.

metrics.label: LTV:CAC Ratio
metrics.note: Early stage ratio with clear path to 4:1+. Calculate using actual customer behavior, not projections.

metrics.label: Gross Margin
metrics.note: Software gross margin after COGS. Sub-70% requires explanation and clear path to target margins.

metrics.label: Net Promoter Score
metrics.note: NPS indicates customer satisfaction and referral likelihood. Strong NPS supports organic growth.

metrics.label: Activation Rate
metrics.note: Percentage of signups completing key activation milestones. Critical for product-led growth models.

metrics.label: Time to Value
metrics.note: Days from signup to first value realization. Faster TTV correlates with better retention.
